  • Element
org.statefulj.framework.core.annotations

Annotation Type StatefulController


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Component
public @interface StatefulController
    The StatefulController annotation defines a Finite State Machine for the specified managed Entity. A StatefulController is a Spring Component that will be managed by Spring via Component scanning.
    Author:
    Andrew Hall

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      Class<?> clazz
      The Entity class managed by the StatefulController
      String startState
      The Starting State.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String[] blockingStates
      Defines the set of "Blocking" States.
      String factoryId
      The bean Id of the Factory for this Entity.
      String finderId
      The bean Id of the Finder for this Entity.
      Transition[] noops
      A set of NOOP transitions
      String persisterId
      The bean Id of the Persister for this Entity.
      int retryAttempts
      Specify the number of times StatefulJ should attempt to handle the event.
      int retryInterval
      The interval, in milliseconds, between each retry attempt
      String stateField
      The name of the managed State field.
      String value
      The value may indicate a suggestion for a logical component name, to be turned into a Spring bean in case of an autodetected component.

    • Element Detail

      • startState

        public abstract String startState
        The Starting State. If there is a transition from this State, the framework will pass in a new instance of the Managed Entity. It is the responsibility of the StatefulController to persist the new instance.
        Returns:
        Starting State

      • clazz

        public abstract Class<?> clazz
        The Entity class managed by the StatefulController
        Returns:
        Entity Class

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The value may indicate a suggestion for a logical component name, to be turned into a Spring bean in case of an autodetected component.
        Returns:
        the suggested component name, if any
        Default:
        ""

      • stateField

        public abstract String stateField
        The name of the managed State field. If blank, the Entity will be inspected for a field annotated with State
        Returns:
        Name of the State field
        Default:
        ""

      • factoryId

        public abstract String factoryId
        The bean Id of the Factory for this Entity. The Factory Class must implement the Factory Interface. If not specified, the StatefulJ Framework will use the default Factory Implementation.
        Returns:
        Id of the Factory Bean
        Default:
        ""

      • finderId

        public abstract String finderId
        The bean Id of the Finder for this Entity. The Finder Class must implement the Finder Interface. If not specified, the StatefulJ Framework will use the default Finder Implementation.
        Returns:
        Id of the Finder Bean
        Default:
        ""

      • persisterId

        public abstract String persisterId
        The bean Id of the Persister for this Entity. The Persister is responsible for updating the State field for the Stateful Entity. The Persister must implement the org.statefulj.framework.core.model.Persister Interface. If not specified, the StatefulJ Framework will use the default Persister Implementation.
        Returns:
        Id of the Persister Bean
        Default:
        ""

      • blockingStates

        public abstract String[] blockingStates
        Defines the set of "Blocking" States. A Blocking State is a State that "block" an event from being handled until the FSM transitions out of the Blocking State
        Returns:
        Array of Blocking States
        Default:
        {}

      • noops

        public abstract Transition[] noops
        A set of NOOP transitions
        Returns:
        Array of NOOP Transitions
        Default:
        {}

      • retryAttempts

        public abstract int retryAttempts
        Specify the number of times StatefulJ should attempt to handle the event. If retryAttempts is -1, then it will always attempt to handle the event
        Returns:
        number of retry attempts
        Default:
        20

      • retryInterval

        public abstract int retryInterval
        The interval, in milliseconds, between each retry attempt
        Returns:
        retry interval in milliseconds
        Default:
        250
